author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
Beneath the fierce dragon's sigh, there spreads a palpable dread,
Knife and chariot haunt the East, where peace once tread.
In the realm of gold and silk, unrest is fueled by strife,
As shadows of economic blight slice through life.

In Vietnam, fortunes of war have smiled, alas,
Tariff's refuge provided a passport to bypass.
Yet fires of the Trumpet's trade war spreads a chilling effect,
A looming threat hangs, its damage unchecked.

In Syria's heart, the cross bears both hope and fear,
As the tide of faith ebbs, the message unclear.
Damascus' captors promise equal patriation,
Yet, the Christmas bells toll with uncertain expectation.

feedItems.title: China Races to Squelch Unrest as Signs of Economic Malaise Spread
feedItems.description: Knife attacks and car rammings have officials unnerved about widespread societal discontent.

feedItems.title: Vietnam Won Big in Donald Trump's First Trade War. Now, It's a Target.
feedItems.description: The incoming administration has signaled that a backdoor that lets manufacturers avoid China tariffs could slam shut.

feedItems.title: Syria's Christians Prepare for Holiday With Hope---and Fear
feedItems.description: Islamist rebels now in control in Damascus have pledged full rights and equality to religious and ethnic minorities. Many Christians say time will tell.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
In Syria was a path deep and fine,
For Lebanon’s militia and Persia’s claim divine.
But lo! Assad's fall doth wasted the line,
Alas! Cried Hezbollah, our lifeline doth decline.

In the land of Morning Calm, with politics unkind,
Brewed from a Cold-War, divisions we find.
Yoon Suk Yeol, thy decision maligned,
Military folly hath the nation confined.

India, land bewitched by the toxic fog,
Battles it artfully with mechanisms odd.
Antismog guns and drones ply the smog,
But mere plasters these, in the looming murk clogged.

feedItems.title: Hezbollah Chief Says Assad's Fall Severed Key Supply Line From Iran
feedItems.description: The loss of the route through Syria is a blow to the Lebanese militia and its most important ally, Tehran.

feedItems.title: Ruthless Politics of South Korea Is Rooted in Cold-War History
feedItems.description: The lasting effects of pre-democracy divisions help to explain Yoon Suk Yeol’s disastrous decision to enact military control.

feedItems.title: India's Novel Attempts at Battling Deadly Air Pollution Are Falling Short
feedItems.description: Residents see antismog guns and drones as “Band-Aid” solutions for a serious air-pollution problem.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
Upon the hill, a stout goat peers,
To whence the missing billions rears,
From despotic rule, half-century of tears,
Rabbits in law seek for justice to bear.

Between a dog and bear, a chase,
A dance 'neath Baltic's frosty grace,
Sabotaged flight, shadows embrace,
In NATO's unseen, a new conflict's space.

Beneath the moon, sly snails converse,
To Assad's overthrow, they rehearse,
Sought swift transition, chaos to reverse,
In the heart of Syria, a tale diverse.

feedItems.title: The Hunt for the Assad Dynasty's Missing Billions Begins
feedItems.description: The family stashed away its wealth over half a century of despotic rule. Human-rights lawyers are leading efforts to find the assets—and recover them for the Syrian people.

feedItems.title: Brush With Russia in Baltic Points to New Flashpoint in NATO-Moscow Shadow War
feedItems.description: Sabotage, warning shots, disruption of air traffic and dangerous military maneuvering are all part of the intensifying clandestine campaign in Europe, officials say.

feedItems.title: Washington in Direct Talks With Islamist Faction That Toppled Assad
feedItems.description: U.S., allies are pressing for a swift transition in Syria to avert a descent into chaos.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In Venezuela, a dark and stormy beckon calls,
Teens captive chained 'gainst fortified walls.
Raging tempest of protests, election's shame,
Like Thor's hammer's fall, a people's claim.

In Southern realm where the dragon roars,
Impeached stands Yoon, while chaos soars.
He who steered the ship against fierce gales,
Must yield the helm until justice avails.

On Syrian sands, 'neath the raven's eye,
Russian bear withdraws with a sigh.
Khmeimim's winds, Tartus' shore,
Know the grip of the north no more.

feedItems.title: Venezuela Never Had So Many Political Prisoners. Seven of Them Are Teens.
feedItems.description: The adolescents are among the estimated 2,200 people the regime said it arrested in July during protests over the country’s disputed presidential election.

feedItems.title: South Korea Impeaches President Yoon Suk Yeol Over Martial-Law Decision
feedItems.description: The prime minister is set to assume presidential powers on an interim basis. The constitutional court will now review the vote, which could take months.

feedItems.title: Russia Begins Packing Up Military Equipment in Syria, Satellite Images Show
feedItems.description: The air base at Khmeimim and the naval installation at Tartus had become synonymous with Russia’s intervention in Syria.
